page.title: 11TREGONY IN THE 1890'S
page.content: TREGONY WAS A BOROUGH TOWN THERE WAS A TOWN CLOCK,BAND,OVEN,CRIER, LAMP- LIGHTER,CRICKET TEAM AND A TOWN ARMS. A MARKET PLACE WAS BEHIND THE CLOCK. TREGONY WAS A MARKET TOWN. THE AVERAGE BOYS WAGE WAS 3/6d THE MANS 12/6d. THE SHOPS PROVIDED FOR THE VILLAGES AND SURROUNDING COTTAGES NEEDS. THE POPULATION WAS AT LEAST 500. THE LARGEST STORE INCLUDED THE POST OFFICE. THERE WERE 3 BLACKSMITHS AND SHOEING SHOPS AND ONE SADDLER AND PLUMBER. THE OVEN WAS SITUATED IN WELL STREET. MOST HOUSES HAD NO OVEN. THE ONLY TRANSPORT WAS HORSE DRAWN VEHICLES. THE FARE TO TRURO OR ST AUSTELL WAS 1/-D. THERE WERE FOUR CHURCHES EACH RAN A SUNDAY SCHOOL.THE CHURCH HALL WAS THE COLLEGE SCHOOL ROOM.THERE WAS A BOARDING SCHOOL CALLED HART HOUSE NEAR CUBY CHURCH WHICH BURNT DOWN, (SEE 12)
